text: Hello! i’m trying to remove the blue underline from a link based CTA. when i use <a style= “text-decoration: none;“> it removes the actual link completely and I can’t click it? Any ideas?

I’m looking for a way to use HubSpot data in Google Tag Manager.  For example, it is really easy to use hsVars in GTM - I’m looking for a documentation of these variables & possibilities to have more useful data for analytics & advertising purposes. Can someone help me?

Is there a way to create custom taxonomies (such as Tags) for blogs? If there isn’t, what alternatives should I be looking to using to create a blog (or a like) where each post can have multiple “tags” of various types?
Hey <@UGMD3NH70>, here's HubSpot's knowledge doc on working with blog tags in HubSpot - <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-blog/create-and-manage-blog-tags>

Hey <@UHFNPGKT5>, I'm not too familiar with GTM, but it sounds like you might benefit from using the tracking code API - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/tracking_code_overview>
Otherwise, I'm not sure how you'd go about accessing otherwise undocumented HS tracking code variables.

Yes, I’m aware of that documentation. I was wondering if it were possible to create a “tag type. So instead of _just_ tags there would be a created tags system with the name “Categories” and user entered tags that are under the “Categories” taxonomy.

Ah, that's what you meant. Thanks for clarifying.
I wouldn't say there is a go-to method for categorizing blogs beyond the native 'tag' feature. I've seen customers create unique blog instances to represent each category (but this prevents posts from belonging to more than one category.)
I've also seen HubL tags implemented on the blog template, which allow you to assign posts to a category or multiple categories - <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-tags> - A choice field on the blog template would be a fairly scalable way to implement categories within a single blog (but it would require a fair amount of custom HubL to implement whatever it is you're trying to do with your blog's categorization.)
Thanks <@UE24LMGSZ> - I’ll have a look at that one. I’m quite new to HubSpot & need a way to get data printed to html, either about content or about identified users / user ID / CRM data etc…

This is a pretty good catch-all resource in terms of what your export options are from within the HubSpot app. More options with our other API endpoints if you prefer that route. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/>
Actually, this seems to be a good starting point also: <https://trevorfox.com/2018/09/HubSpot-gtm-data-layer/>
